text: If you have any more questions on that specifically let me know and I can chat to her again. Other than that, happy to answer nay other questions you might have. Are you currently at university, or thinking about what to do when you apply?

Right now I’m in yr13 and I’m planning on applying at UCL to do security and crime science. 
But as my safe options I have decided to look at the university of Kent and City to do criminology and criminal justice
I have a question about my options, as I wanna do criminology I was wondering is it useful if I do criminal justice as well or not

I think that would be useful. There are two strands in criminology - one looks at crime within the existing justice system. The other, “radical” criminology asks what could happen if the current justice system was different. In either case, understanding the system would be a big help. So if it was me I would probably go for both - that would also set you apart from other students.
